channel.title: Object Map cutoff
channel.description:
I'm looking for the int/boolean/whatever which cuts objects off from loading after a certain point on the map.
My question is more understandable with this image:
[img]http://zachera.com/rs/fow250.png[/img]
I want to be able to view objects in the area that doesn't have any, unfortunately I have no idea where to start. I've setup the for loops related to map loading in the ObjectManager to use the new map region values in the WorldController, and I've fixed all the "104 values" in pretty much any other class to work with the new map region size.
Thanks.

Assuming one had a great enough understanding of the rendering mechanisms. Hypothetically of course.[/quote]if one was running ones own server, one would hope that one had control

item.title: Object Map cutoff
item.dc:creator: @semaphore semaphore
item.description:
@semaphore wrote:

[quote=“Zachera, post:1, topic:204515”]I’m looking for the int/boolean/whatever which cuts objects off from loading after a certain point on the map.

My question is more understandable with this image:

(img snip)

I want to be able to view objects in the area that doesn’t have any, unfortunately I have no idea where to start. I’ve setup the for loops related to map loading in the ObjectManager to use the new map region values in the WorldController, and I’ve fixed all the “104 values” in pretty much any other class to work with the new map region size.

Thanks.[/quote]

One is able to load the static objects without too much trouble. What one will not be able to do is accurately load stateful objects. (i.e. mining rocks, doors, gates, trees, etc) These objects exist in a default state in the cache but get updated as one moves within range. (i.e. whether a door is opened or closed, whether a rock has ore in it, whether a tree is cut down or available) The problem one will find is that the server controls when one will get this updated information. As a simple example, one may see the rocks in the chasm mining area, but one will not know if they have coal/iron/etc in them. Also, one will not see the players/npcs beyond the set range the server has defined. The ‘fog-of-war’ is server-defined. There is no way around it that I have found. Of course, none of this matters if all one wants to do is load static object data…

Read full topic

item.title: Object Map cutoff
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

i did mention pythagoras theorm you know…

yakman:

if you’re lucky, this distance check will a simple pythagoras-theorem sort of thing

they use it in the calculation which changes tile cordinates to minimap cordinates, it checks for the square of 80

Read full topic

item.title: Object Map cutoff
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“TeleNubby, post:10, topic:204515”]Yakman did you mean Pythagorean Theorem? a^2 + b^2 = c^2? I might just be drawing a blank, as I’m really tired right now, but how would that work here? I’m probably just looking at it wrong, whatever.[/quote] more or less

for 3 dimensions you just add another component so that it is like a^2 + b^2 + d^2 = c^2

distance = sqrt(aa + bb + d*d);

but for efficiency they will not do the square root and just compare the squared values

Read full topic

item.title: Object Map cutoff
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:

Yakman did you mean Pythagorean Theorem? a^2 + b^2 = c^2? I might just be drawing a blank, as I’m really tired right now, but how would that work here? I’m probably just looking at it wrong, whatever.

item.title: Object Map cutoff
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

Ollie:

if i were you, make a static variable called loading, and set it to whatever you want, so you dont need to go and change all the 104 values every time

Well, you’d be increasing object and item containers as well, which’d lag up the whole client, which is actually what I did… xD

Read full topic

item.title: Object Map cutoff
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:7, topic:204515”][quote author=qauters link=topic=270007.msg2219009#msg2219009 date=1210438064]

I can’t offer any suggestions but surely it would make the server lagg more than usual as it is dealing with more data than it should surely thats why there is a limit on it anyway

Everything is loaded from cache, the server will only give you information about objects within the range of view. Exactly the whole visible minimap, just like players/npcs.
The only exception are ground items, which are loaded for the complete 104*104 region, I don’t think you can change that though.
[/quote]
yes you can change it[/quote]
Strange that rs doesn’t block that :S

Read full topic

item.title: Object Map cutoff
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

theres nothing to it, learn a bit about how the rendering of building and landscape features works
eventually you should be able to work out some kind of check, like

if(the distance from camera is smaller then #num#)
renderStuff();

if you’re lucky, this distance check will a simple pythagoras-theorem sort of thing
you seem to be using the 317 client, so you’ll have a small advantage of having some stuff already refactorised, and not getting logged out or banned

Read full topic
